content:
A Quicktime movie file with a .mov extension uploaded to file transfer website WeTransfer has its file extension changed to .qt when downloaded via Firefox. -Behavior did not appear when using a different file sharing/transfer platform (Google Drive) -A different browser (Safari) maintained the correct extension.

The file itself appears to be otherwise intact and not corrupt, and changing the extension back to .mov after downloading effectively resolves this odd little issue.
creator: anandmodi

title: Firefox Multi-Account Containers
content:
Would it be possible to add an option to Firefox Multi-Account Containers to automatically "group up" tabs in the same container so that the tabs for one container are all next to each other?

For example, if I have 3 open "Work" container tabs in the 1, 2, and 3 tab slots, and then my personal email account on the 4th tab slot, opening a website that is set to automatically open in my "Work" container will open in the number 5 tab slot.

I would like an option where instead of opening on the next available tab slot on the bar, it can automatically move the tab to be next to other tabs in my "Work" container. In the example I gave, the tab would open in the number 4 tab slot and push my personal email tab to number 5. I think a toggle for this option would be helpful.

Thank you!
creator: ramzi.ag

title: Firefox 119.0 - Unable to set PDF Orientation
content:
Hey there,

Starting with Firefox v115, you had to set layout.css.page-size.enabled to false in about:config to get the page orientation back for printing PDFs (i.e. Portrait or Landscape).

It seems with the release of v119, this once again is broken and the layout.css.page-size.enabled setting no longer works. Is there something else that needs to be done now? We rely heavily on this and our current workaround is installing the ESR version of Firefox but seems like it'll catch up eventually.

Any help would be greatly appreciated!

Thanks!

title: How to restore bookmarks, history, addons and settings after manual update?
content: Hi, my OS is LinuxMint 20. I noticed that my firefox version is 86 even though it was set to update automatically, nor was there a button to update manually. So I downloaded version 119 and unpacked it in a new folder. I did not find an installation file but the firefox file started up, but it was unconfigured and it could not find the bookmarks of my old still installed version even though the old version was still the standard browser and it did find the Opera browsers bookmarks. I found the old version in /lib/firefox, backed the folder up, and manually copied the files of the unpacked folder over, intending to update it that way. But the effect was only that the new unconfigured version started up. Restoring the old version by copying the backup folder back to /lib/firefox did not work; result was an error message that starting up an old version required a new profile, but that option did not restore my bookmark etc either. I took a look and it seems that these things are stored in another folder anyway (/home/.mozilla) but how can I access them? They certainly are still there given the folder size of 250MB.

title: Gmail search results capture keyboard shortcuts

The problem is that if my mouse happens to be over where that list appears, then often, once the list appears, subsequent keystrokes are misinterpreted as keyboard shortcut commands, rather than additional characters to add to the text in the search box (the focus is on the search box while I'm typing). This doesn't happen in Chrome, but I'm not sure if it's a Firefox or Gmail issue. Anyone else see this? Josh
